abstract.text: Creates a location object with the specified latitude and longitude.

inlineContent.text: The latitude of the geographical coordinate.
The longitude of the geographical coordinate.
A location object initialized with the specified geographical coordinate.
Use this method to create location objects that are not necessarily based on the user’s current location. Typically, you acquire location objects from your

object, which returns the user’s actual location. However, you might use this method when you want to represent any location on a map. For example, you might create an object to represent the user’s intended destination.
This method records the latitude and longitude values you provide, and it initializes other properties to appropriate default values. Specifically, this method sets the
to indicate that the altitude is invalid, sets the
property to the time at which the returned object was created.

abstract.text: Obtain the geographic location and orientation of a device.
The latitude, longitude, and course information reported by the system.
The altitude above mean sea level associated with a location, measured in meters.
The direction in which the device is traveling, measured in degrees and relative to due north.
The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters.
Creates a location object with the specified coordinate, altitude, course, and accuracy information.
Creates a location object with the specified coordinate, altitude, and course information.
Creates a location object with the specified coordinate and altitude information.
Creates a location object with the specified latitude and longitude.
The instantaneous speed of the device, measured in meters per second.
The time at which this location was determined.
The validity of the altitude values, and their estimated uncertainty, measured in meters.
A latitude or longitude value specified in degrees.
The object you use to start and stop the delivery of location-related events to your app.

inlineContent.text: The latitude of the geographical coordinate.
The longitude of the geographical coordinate.
A location object initialized with the specified geographical coordinate.
